member.name: T:Microsoft.Fabric.Logging.CustomDataCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of custom data.
member.remarks: This class is not thread-safe to keep performance overhead low.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fabric.Logging.CustomDataCollection.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:
A value indicating whether to add values immediately or wait until logging is executed.
When a log level is disabled, the custom data is not initialized, and the performance overhead is low.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fabric.Logging.CustomDataCollection.#ctor(System.Action{Microsoft.Fabric.Logging.ICustomDataCollection})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An action to populate custom data lazily where is only invocated if log executes for current log level.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fabric.Logging.CustomDataCollection.Add``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Adds a custom data element to the collection.
member.typeparam: The type of the value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fabric.Logging.CustomDataCollection.TryAdd``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Tries to add a custom data element to the collection.
member.typeparam: The type of the value.
member.returns: The current collection.

member.summary: Get a pinnable reference to the builder. Does not ensure there is a null char after This overload is pattern matched in the C# 7.3+ compiler so you can omit the explicit method call, and write eg "fixed (char* c = builder)"

member.summary: Formats and logs a debug log message.
member.param: The event id associated with the log. You can specify a .
Custom data related to the log.
Format string of the log message in message template format. Example: "User {User} logged in from {Address}"
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.
